byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: South Sudanese opposition leader Riek Machar is sworn in as vice president two years after start of county's civil war, event seen as vital to reunification; many express doubts that Machar will be able to work with chief rival Pres Salva Kiir and tensions will continue.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Machar emerged from exile to be restored as vice president, but serious questions remained for a country ravaged by more than two years of civil war.

headline.main: Riek Machar, South Sudan Opposition Leader, Returns as Part of Peace Deal
headline.print_headline: South Sudan Opposition Leader Returns, Becoming No. 2 as Part of Peace Deal

snippet: Mr. Machar emerged from exile to be restored as vice president, but serious questions remained for a country ravaged by more than two years of civil war.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
